DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder First Neuroglial Tumor Symptom Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to specify the patient's/participant's presenting symptom of disease that presented first.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant brain and spinal cord tumor that arises from glial cells (astrocytes, oligodendrocytes, ependymal cells).  Tumors that arise from astrocytes are called astrocytic tumors or astrocytomas.  Tumors that arise from oligodendrocytes are called oligodendroglial tumors.  Tumors that arise from ependymal cells are called ependymomas. -- 2004_An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In medicine, having to do with the movement of body parts.: alteration or modification.

Concepts.definition: In medicine, having to do with the movement of body parts.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the senses.: alteration or modification.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the senses.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Sight; the faculty of vision, the perception of objects by the eye.: alteration or modification.

Concepts.definition: The faculty of vision, the perception of objects by the eye.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Mental and Behavioral Signs and Symptoms

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Mental and Behavioral Signs and Symptoms
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Clinical evidence of disease resulting from mental and/or behavioral dysfunction.

Concepts.longName: Mental and Behavioral Signs and Symptoms
Concepts.definition: Clinical evidence of disease resulting from mental and/or behavioral dysfunction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pain in various parts of the head, not confined to the area of distribution of any nerve.

Concepts.definition: Pain in various parts of the head, not confined to the area of distribution of any nerve.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.--2004

Concepts.definition: Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: signs that a person has a condition or disease. Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain(NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant brain and spinal cord tumor that arises from glial cells (astrocytes, oligodendrocytes, ependymal cells).  Tumors that arise from astrocytes are called astrocytic tumors or astrocytomas.  Tumors that arise from oligodendrocytes are called oligodendroglial tumors.  Tumors that arise from ependymal cells are called ependymomas. -- 2004:An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant brain and spinal cord tumor that arises from glial cells (astrocytes, oligodendrocytes, ependymal cells). Tumors that arise from astrocytes are called astrocytic tumors or astrocytomas. Tumors that arise from oligodendrocytes are called oligodendroglial tumors. Tumors that arise from ependymal cells are called ependymomas.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
